sourceMeaningMnemonic: You need to bring <radical>charcoal</radical> under this <radical>roof</radical> to heat the <kanji>dormitory</kanji>. You live in this dormitory with a bunch of other kids, and you all have to take turns bringing in the charcoal from outside to heat it.
meaningInfo: Imagine looking at a dormitory chore wheel and seeing it's your turn to carry in the charcoal this week. Bleh!
readingMnemonic: The <kanji>dormitory</kanji> is on an island, so when you go out to get the charcoal you have to take a <reading>row</reading> (<ja>りょう</ja>) boat. You row and row and row until you reach the shed with all the charcoal. Then you row and row and row it back to the dormitory.
readingInfo: The dormitory row boat leaks a little too, so by the time you get back you really need to light the charcoal and heat up!
